content.p: Seth Godin showed this slide during a recent presentation at Google:
What's the biggest web design mistake of 2004?
content.blockquote: 1. Believing people care about you and your web site.
content.p: Why isn't anyone reading our blog?
content.blockquote:
1. You're not a good-looking female who likes posting naked pictures of herself.
2. There's nothing in it for them.
content.p: This is not to say that users don't care:
content.blockquote: The main point: users don't care about you as much as they care about themselves.
content.p: Users just aren't that into you. It's not personal. It's business. Unless what you're writing …

ul.li: makes them feel like they rule

content.p: … it's irrational to expect users to care about it.

Every time you create something – whether it's a website, a client app, a blog post, a powerpoint presentation, or an email – ask yourself, "so what?" If you can't answer that question convincingly, reformulate and try again.
